direction.raw_text: .  EDGAR'S PLACE - DAY                                    2 It's a simple cabin dwarfed by a big, ramshackle barn.  EDGAR DEEMS (60s), a weathered desert rat of a hermit, is walking his donkey around in circles. Now, rattling toward them down an endless dirt road, comes an old, sun-bleached Buick.  It stops and out leans OLD FRED (70s) wearing a sweat-stained fedora.  The two friends nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Fred climbs out with a bushel basket of carrots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edgar takes the carrots and feeds one to the donkey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men nod, and Old Fred drives off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How's she doing?

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: But, suddenly, we hear the donkey restlessly stomping its hooves and braying.  Edgar turns, concerned.  Now we hear an odd sound.  Distant thunder?  The wind?  The donkey gets more and more frantic. The barn shudders violently.  Frightened birds explode from the eaves.  Dust puffs from every old seam.  Roof shingles rain down.  Edgar stares in amazement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then another sound -- the donkey starts screeching in wild panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Edgar races back to the barn and flings open the doors.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Let's get you out of the sun for a spell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I'll get you some fresh water.

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) ...some kind of earthquake !?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Justine, hang on! I'm coming!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  EDGAR'S BARN - DAY                                     3 Dust swirls through the air.  But -- the barn in empty.  No donkey.  Now Edgar is hit by a ghastly stench.  He staggers back, and covers his nose with a handkerchief.  Then he sees, splattered across the walls -- blood !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He raises his arms above the door frame.  When he lowers them he's holding a 12 gauge shotgun.  He races outside, ready to shoot, but there's nothing -- as far as the eye can see.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What in the name of Jehovah...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  CLIFFS - DAWN                                          4 The sun lights up spectacular sheer cliffs which plunge 1000 feet from a ruggedly beautiful high-desert plateau.  At the top of the cliffs, silhouetted against the dawn, a lone cow- boy seems to gaze in deep contemplation at the sunrise.  As we MOVE IN, we realize he's actually peeing over the cliff. This is VALENTINE MCKEE (25).  Smart and good looking, Val has nevertheless managed to underachieve brilliantly.  He coasts through life, following the path of least resistance
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which has brought him to this dubious rustic existence on the edge of civilization.  But lately he's beginning to wonder why he hasn't accomplished more in his 25 years. As a few sleepy cows gaze at him, sleepy Val shuffles over to his battered old pickup truck.  A hand-painted sign on the door reads: "V & E -- All Type's of Job's."  Indeed, the pick-up bed is jumbled with tools and supplies for every conceivable odd job -- and the noisily snoring form of his partner huddled in a dirty sleeping bag.  Val raps on the side of the truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response from the sleeping bag.  Val stares at the cows chewing their cud -- and perks up as he gets an idea.  He gently steps onto the truck's running board, then suddenly starts jumping up and down as hard as he can, rocking the truck violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sleeping bag tries to get up and run for it.  It tumbles out of the back of the pickup.  While Val laughs uproar- iously, EARL BASSET (43) claws his way out of the bag, looks around wildly, and finds himself staring at three motionless cows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl is a good-ol' boy who has lived his life just like Val, drifting from job to job.  He knows why he hasn't accom- plished anything, and often tries to impart his hard-won wisdom to Val, but the last thing the younger man wants is advice. Earl stretches.  The men begin a silent ritual:  Earl gropes through his pockets for a cigarette, but only finds a lighter.  Meanwhile, Val digs in his pockets, coming up with cigarettes, but no lighter.  Typical of these two, each guy always has half of what he needs.  Eventually they sort it out,  trading the necessary implements. Earl reaches for a coffee-pot on a battered Coleman stove on the tailgate.  But it's cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl raises his fist.  This is The Challenge, and it instantly triggers the partners' conflict-resolution technique.  They solve all disputes using the children's game of "scissors, rock, paper."  Earl raises his fist in response.  The game is played swiftly and silently -- one, two, three.  On three, Val mimes "paper" (open hand.  Earl mimes "scissors" (two extended fingers).  Scissors cuts paper.  Val has lost.  He shrugs and starts pumping up the stove fuel tank.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Good morning, Mr. Bassett, this is your wake-up call.  Please move your fat ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  VIOLA'S PLACE - DAY                                    16 CLOSE ON a stencilled sign: PHAM VAN'S U-RENT -- CESSPOOL, SEPTIC TANKS.  PULL OUT to see Val and Earl have rented a portable septic pump (perhaps trailer mounted).  The aged machine reeks of and drips with its ignoble cargo.  The intake hose has been repaired so often it looks to be more tape than hose.  Grimacing Val threads the slimy hose down through the open top of Viola's cesspool. Beside them is Viola's well-kept mobile home on a low hill not far from Pham Van's store.  Well-kept flower gardens surround the place.  VIOLA, a sweet little old lady, watches the men work while straining to hold the leash of her tiny but ferocious dog.  The dog yaps continuously, lunging at Val and Earl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val gets up and starts the pump's gas engine.

direction.raw_text: .   VAL AND EARL'S TRAILER - DAY                          17 Val and Earl's beat-up mobile home is just down the street from Pham Van's store.  Val and Earl, now in cleaner clothes, march out resolutely.  Val has a portable TV in one hand and a framed COORS beer sign in the other.  Earl unhooks the clothes line and dumps it, clothes and all, into the back of their truck, on top of the rest of their belongings. They stare at each other for a moment.  This is it.  No going back.  They leap into the truck.  As they drive off, Val leans out and yanks their wooden nameplate ("E. Basset -- V. McKee") off the mailbox.

direction.raw_text: . CANYON ROAD - DAY                                       33 Carmine and Howard continue repairing the road, Carmine still using the noisy jackhammer.  Val and Earl drive up.

direction.raw_text: But he edges over to the truck and takes out a heavy steel pry-bar to keep within easy reach. Carmine goes back to work, pounding the asphalt with the jackhammer.  Suddenly the blade strikes something beneath the road, something soft.  We hear a strange, unearthly shriek from underground.  A weird orange goo gushes up around the blade.  Then the jackhammer takes off by itself like a harpoon stuck in a whale!  Carmine gets tangled in the jack- hammer's air-hose and is dragged along, shouting for help. Howard chases him down the embankment and into the scrub- brush.  He hears Carmine screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now there is only silence.  Howard crashes through the brush.  All he finds is the torn end of the air-hose -- which suddenly sucks down into the ground.  He's momentarily staggered by an awful smell, but forces himself to keep looking.  He lets the pry-bar drag on the ground.  Then something -- it looks like a mouth or a horrid beak -- shoots out of the ground and grips the pry-bar with uncanny strength!  Howard drops his weapon and scrambles madly away. He clambers back onto the road.  But almost immediately cracks form in the pavement around him.  More beak-things break through the asphalt between him and his truck. He dashes across the road, scrambling up the embankment.  He clings precariously to a tree root, looking down -- where'd they go?  Suddenly the dirt around him begins to "bubble." Several hungry beaks break through and grab him, yanking him head first into the embankment.  Then the embankment gives way, crashing down onto the road, taking with it a nearby telephone pole and snapping the lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  JIM AND MEGANS'S HOUSE - ESTABLISH - NIGHT             43 In the vast desert night a single floodlight illuminates Jim and Megan's partially finished house.  Their station wagon is parked out front.  A country and western tune drifts to us from it's radio. As we MOVE CLOSER, we see the floodlight is powered by a small, softly purring generator set maybe fifty feet away. Jim and Megan, both exhausted, unload a big stack of roofing shingles from their station wagon.  Jim starts to lift a package of shingles but gives up and sits on the tailgate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just then the whirring of the generator becomes strangely muffled.  The floodlight flickers.  Now the generator dies. Darkness engulfs them.  The car radio music drones on incongruously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jim digs out a powerful flashlight and heads over toward the generator.  Megan lies back, taking a welcome breather. After a moment:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm dead.  Let's finish in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We have to go into Bixby in the morning. (grins devilishly) The concrete blocks are in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The con...!  Oh my God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just keep looking at that beautiful sky.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the sky that's going to be over our roof every night, when we're done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (joking) Ah, but consider this, if we don't finish the roof, we can looks at that sky all the time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Damn that thing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sarcastic) We could always buy a new generator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, what's wrong with it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It's...gone...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Baffled, he sweeps the whole area with the flashlight.  Megan joins him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The severed electric cable stops at the edge of a cone-shaped depression in the dirt where the generator sat.  He hands her the flashlight and kneels.  We watch tensely as he probes the loose earth with his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Megan grabs his shirt, trying to pull him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, about ten feet away -- WHOOMP!!  The generator shoots up out of the ground!  Jim and Megan dive for cover as it sails through the air, and crashes to earth.  They stare, transfixed.  The generator is dented and bent almost beyond recognition -- and covered with oozing slime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Megan is all action.  She yanks him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We again hear that mysterious rumbling sound.  Jim stops, sweeping the flashlight around them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hustles him bodily toward the car during:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly he drops knee-deep into ground!  Megan is thrown off balance and tumbles to one side.  The flashlight falls, lighting them at an eerie low angle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear sickening CRUNCHES from below the earth.  He SCREAMS in excruciating agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He struggles wildly, but just sinks further down!  Megan slides a 2X4 over to Jim.  He grabs it like a drowning man, trying to keep himself from being pulled down.  But he's pulled with suck power the 2X4 snaps! His head is going under.  Megan desperately tries to dig the smothering earth away, but she's losing.  Now only his arms are above ground.  She pulls with all her might, but he sinks inexorably down, down.  She's pulled flat on the ground. He's gone. The next instant, a vicious hook-tentacle erupts through the earth, missing Megan's face by inches.  She scrambles back frantically.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You sure this is where it was?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Am I sure?! (points with flashlight) It was right there.  There's the cord.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Maybe the ground caved in.  There's a lot of old mines and stuff around here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well don't then!  You don't want to fall in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on.  Get away from it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God, what a stink!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Hear that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind !  Let's go!  Let's just go into town or something!  Jim, please !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, I bet it's geological or something, like natural gas, or a geyser.  They stink like that. Remember in Yellowstone...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Something's got me!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh, God!  Get me Out!!  GET ME OUT!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: pursues Megan toward the car, just missing her as she dives in through the open tailgate.  She slams it after her.  The talons rake across the car, scratching the glass. Megan tumbles into the front seat.  Thank God the keys are in the ignition.  She starts the engine.  But outside the "snake things" attack the car in a frenzy, slashing blindly.  A rear tire is totally shredded just as: Megan floors it.  The car lurches forward but the mutilated tire falls apart.  The wheel rim digs into the loose earth and the car is stuck.  With no other recourse, Megan locks the door, rolls up the windows and cowers in the middle of the car, panting, sobbing.  The radio is still playing a happy cowboy tune.  She peeks out.  They gave up?  She's safe?  Nothing happens for a moment, then -- The car starts to shake and shudder!  Dust wells up around the windows. Outside we see a bizarre sight.  The earth around the rear of the car is "boiling," dirt flying in all directions -- and the car starts to sink into the ground !! Megan wildly honks the horn!  The car looks just like a ship going down by the stern, hood tilting up gracefully.  The back windows shatter, dirt pouring in!  Megan smashes the windshield with a small fire extinguisher and scrambles out on the hood.  But there's no hope.  The car keeps sinking, titling now almost ninety degrees, forcing her onto a precarious perch on the grille -- sinking, sinking. Out of her mind with terror, she keeps softly murmuring the same hopeless phrases:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stop it!  Stop it!  Somebody stop it...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - JIM AND MEGAN'S HOUSE - VERY WIDE - NIGHT     46 The headlights are two ironic beacons sending their beams skyward through the roiling dust into the night sky.  The sound of the radio becomes muffled.  The headlights sink from view -- and then Megan's scream floats across the desert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAWN                                47 Out front of Pham Van's, nervous Val and Earl saddle up the horses while Pham loads their saddle bags with food.  Every- one has gathered to see them off.  There's an air of tension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl pulls their old Smith and Wesson revolver and battered Winchester rifle out of the pick-up truck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So does Earl.  He raises his hand.  They swiftly do a round of scissors-rock-paper.  Earl loses.  He hands Val the rifle. Just then, Burt and Heather pull up in their Blazer, climbing out with their hunting rifles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val and Earl mount up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl takes the awesome-looking gun with a smug glance at Val.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heather unhooks a box of cartridges from her belt and hands it to Earl.  Suddenly there's a blood-curdling SCREAM!  The door to Pham Van's flies open.  Out staggers Melvin, wrapped in Pham Van's hook-tentacle, writhing in apparent agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People scatter like sheep.  Burt and Heather have guns trained on him in an instant.  Then everyone realizes it's a sick joke.  Melvin collapses with laughter.  Burt is livid. He almost shot Melvin.  He charges over and yanks the kid to his feet, screaming:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pham rushes over and grabs his precious tentacle.  As people calm down, Val and Earl gaze nervously at the vast desert before them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They ride out to an adlib chorus:  "Keep your heads down;" "Go careful, boys;" "Keep a sharp lookout;" etc.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (eyeing the horses) Pham, we don't want to be stuck on a couple of canners.  They better be fast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Relax.  A snake thing like that couldn't move too quick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Screw you.  For all you know they could fly .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want the rifle or the Smith?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (definite) The rifle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You guys all set?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ready as we'll ever be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Heather and I are going to drive around a little, see if we can find that college girl and tell her to get her ass back into town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good idea.  And we'll swing by the doctor's place.  They were going to go into Bixby but we don't know if they left before the road was out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold on.  You guys oughta take something that packs more punch than that thirty-thirty.  Take one of our Browning autos, or even my model seventy... (offers her hunting rifle) It's three-seventy-five H and H mag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gee...thanks, Heather.  Hope we don't need it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !  IT's GOT ME!  AAAAHGH!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You stupid punk!  You came that close, that close!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One of these days, Melvin, somebody's gonna kick your ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well...you fellas watch yourselves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come back with the Sheriff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sheriff, like hell.  Come back with the National Guard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - DAY                                           48 Val and Earl ride along, very tiny in the vast, lonely landscape, and very on edge.  Constantly looking all around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val doesn't want to hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Faint Country and Western radio music drifts to them. They're nearing Jim and Megan's house.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know, we can't possibly make Bixby by nightfall.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That means we're gonna be out here, like, in the dark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (resentfully) Great.  Thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  JIM AND MEGAN'S HOUSE - DAY                            49 Val knocks on the door to the mobile home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No answer.  He opens the door and peers inside.  Behind him Earl steps out of the half-finished house and shrugs.  Nobody around.  Wind rustles the plastic sheeting over the windows. Strangely they can still hear the muffled radio clearly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk briskly to their horses.  Earl snatches Heather's rifle from its saddle scabbard.  Val pulls out the Winchester.  Earl tries to reassure himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They focus on the sound and walk gingerly toward it, keeping constant watch in every direction.  The ground here is all torn up like the sheep pen -- and the music is coming from underneath !  What the hell is going on? Val scrapes at the dirt with his boot -- and finds the headlight of Jim and Megan's station wagon, still on, glaring up at him.  He drops down and wildly sweeps away more dirt, revealing more of the car's grille and hood -- and blood - soaked dirt which sticks to his hand.  He leaps away, frantically rubbing the blood off on his pants.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, doctor, anybody here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (spooked) Oh, man, I hate this shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Car's gone.  We just missed them, that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then where's the goddamn Conway Twitty coming from?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh, man...oh, man...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - CONCRETE DITCH - DAY                          50 Val and Earl are riding at full gallop.  They race alongside a concrete-lined flood-control ditch and veer off to follow a barbed wire fence which crosses the ditch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - BARBED WIRE FENCE - DAY                       51 They ride along the fence during:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the horses stop short.  In a frenzy they wheel around, rear up, refusing to go on.  The cowboys fight to control them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Earl's already drawing his rifle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He draws his rifle.  They look wildly in all directions at once -- but there's nothing, only empty desert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They keep staring.  The horses keep pacing nervously.  Then
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here's the plan...We don't even stop.  Ride like hell.  Tonight we keep right on going.  We'll walk the horses.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is the plan...I mean, goddamn it!  What the hell are those things?  How could they bury an entire Plymouth station wagon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would they do it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew it!  Pham Van wouldn't know a decent horse if...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up!  They got wind of something they don't like!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) But I don't see anything!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Earl's horse rears wildly and falls!  Earl goes flying. Val wheels around wildly, dismounts and runs to Earl, who's bruised and winded but basically unhurt.  They think Earl's horse just tripped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their eyes bulge.  Several "snake things" have engulfed the horse's head, sucking, crushing, slurping.  Val's horse goes berserk and gallops for the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly they realize what that means -- the thing could come up under them !!  The cowboys scramble frantically away. But nothing pursues them.  They pause, glancing back nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val raises his rifle and takes a well-aimed shot, hitting one of them.  Orange goo spurts out.  We hear a deafening shriek as all the "snake things" instantly zip back underground. Then -- A HUGE MOUND OF EARTH RISES UP UNDER VAL AND EARL!! The cowboys tumble down its side, Val losing his rifle.  They roll over and stare dumbfounded at the mound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mound of earth turns toward them.  The ground splits open and out rises -- a huge head!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The monster is a horrendous thirty-foot long eating machine! Its head is eyeless, utterly alien, covered with tough boney plates which close together to form a cork-screw point. The cowboys stumble back toward the fence in speechless terror.  The creature slides toward them, pushing through the earth like a whale through water.  Now it opens its mouth -- but it's like a grotesque flower, boney plates spreading open like petals, revealing a huge, slimy, fleshy, oozing orifice! And inside the mouth, a ghastly multi-tentacled tongue! These are the "snake things," not snakes at all but actually the horrid hook-tentacles that can shoot out six feet to snag their prey! The monster snorts and snuffs, throwing up plumes of dust, sounding like a horrendous pig.  It sinks into the earth and charges!  We see the hump of earth move toward them faster and faster but then it disappears as the creature goes deeper. Val and Earl leap sideways and run along the fence.  The creature goes straight and slams into a fencepost from below. All we see is the fencepost knocked at a crazy angle. The cowboys keep running.  The creature regroups and charges after them, hitting each fencepost in turn, sending weird sinuous shock waves along the barbed wire, making almost musical twanging sounds.  Val looks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And as if that weren't enough, Earl points to more trouble ahead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Hey, you okay?  You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah...yeah. (turning to the horse) What about the hor...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What in the name...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's how they get you!  They're under the goddamn ground !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell are they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: -- A HUGE MOUND OF EARTH RISES UP UNDER VAL AND EARL

dialogue.raw_text: Sons of bitches!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (gasps) There must be a million of them!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (awestruck) Nope...just one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's gaining on us!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .   CONCRETE DITCH - DAY                                  52 The fence runs straight to the edge of the ditch, an eight foot wide gap yawning dead ahead.  The creature churns like a locomotive from behind.  They'll have to try to jump!  They strain desperately for every last fraction of speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They leap and -- they don't do it!!  They smack into the opposite side of the ditch, clawing frantically at the lip, only to tumble to its sloping bottom.  A split second later the charging creature slams like a wrecking ball into the foot-thick concrete wall!  The wall CRACKS AND BULGES OUT!  A hook-tentacle flops out through one of the cracks!  Terrified Val and Earl scramble away.  But the wall holds together. And the, strangely, all is quiet.  The tentacle lays dead still.  Eventually, the cowering cowboys dare to creep back a little closer, still panting, exhausted, jumpy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now orange slime begins to ooze through the cracks in the concrete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He suddenly shakes his fist at the dead beast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They allow themselves a small wheeze of nervous laughter, only to jump like rabbits as some pebbles rattle loudly down the concrete wall behind them.  They whirl to see Rhonda, up on the opposite side of the ditch, staring down at them. She's lugging a bunch of her equipment, including a small folding shovel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val and Earl look at each other, then burst out laughing. Rhonda spots the cracked wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We can do it, we can do it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stupid son of a bitch...knocked itself cold.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cold, my ass!  It's dead!  We killed the bastard!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) You FUCKER!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, guys, how're you doing?  Look, can I ask you something?  Did you just notice something weird? Vibrations?  You know, some kind of earth tremor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .   CONCRETE DITCH - DAY                                  53 The shattered concrete has been pulled away to fully reveal the creature's horrendous head.  Start CLOSE on it: oozing blood, slavering mouth plates hanging open, hook-tentacles lolling out.  WIDEN to see Earl and Rhonda, sweating, dusty and tired, staring in awe and cringing at the stench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can hear a shovel digging up above, and now Val shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl and Rhonda climb up.  CRANE UP with them to REVEAL the whole animal!  Val, digging excitedly with Rhonda's shovel, is just scraping away the last loose dirt from the creature's tail.  The whole length of the immense thirty foot beast is partially uncovered, in king-sized bas-relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods, stepping down to study the creature.  The body is stream-lined, cigar-shaped, maybe eight feet in diameter at its thickest.  It's covered with hundreds of short, rear- pointing, retractable spikes.  Rhonda gingerly jiggles one. It can be pushed in and out of its socket like a plunger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A chilling thought stops her in mid-sentence.  She springs down into the drainage ditch to get her backpack, pulling out her seismograph printouts.  She studies them frantically during:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guys looks at each other.  One thought immediately springs to their minds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While they bask in their fame-to-be, Rhonda continues to study the print-outs, coming to a terrifying conclusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Rhonda interrupts -- now really scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val and Earl shut right up.  Earl edges up a fencepost.  Val sidles up onto a rock during:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda paws through her unwieldy printouts, pointing out jagged ink lines on the graphs, comparing different ones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men leap from their perches and hustle her in the direction she came from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She indicates what to most of us would be a hill, dotted with huge boulders thrusting out of the sandy desert soil like big mushrooms.  The trio jogs toward the hill.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Christ...think it smells like that 'cause it's dead?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't see any eyes...must be totally subterranean...and those tentacles...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think they shoot right outta its mouth, hook you, and pull you right in.  Good thing we stopped it before it killed anybody else.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shudders) Yeah, I'm lucky it didn't find me . (overwhelmed) This is important, you know.  This is like, well, let's say it, it's probably the biggest zoological discovery of the century.  The century?  Forget it. History .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I got it!  Here's the other end! Just look at what we caught here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hushed) This is one big mother!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So this is the guy that had your seismos working overtime?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) It must push itself along with these.  Hundreds of them pushing at once.  That's how it can move so fast.  I mean this thing was tripping sensors all over the valley.  No wonder I couldn't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Rhonda, you ever heard of any thing like this before?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (elbows Earl) Sure, Earl, everybody knows about them.  We just didn't tell you . Come on, nobody's ever seen one of these!  We're really in on something here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pham Van don't get his mitts on this for no measly fifteen bucks!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got that right!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's the plan: we'll get a...a flatbed, I guess, with a big winch, figure a five ton anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Naw, don't want to winch it.  That'd tear it all up.  Want to lift it. Some kind of crane with lifting straps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, hey, shut up!  The way I figure it.  There are five more of these things!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five more?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, darn it, look.  I've got seismographs all over the valley. If you compare the different readings, there have to be five. Here's one at two o'clock yesterday, but here's another one three miles away at the same time. So that's two.  Now, here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll take your word for it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.  Where's your truck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The other side of that dome.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - SEISMOGRAPH - DAY                             54 En route to the truck, they pass near one of Rhonda's seismographs.  Suddenly Earl stumbles as one leg drops knee- deep into the ground!  He screams.  Val wheels and bodily yanks him up.  They back away from the small hole in the ground, calming a little as they realize:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda tenses as she hears a sound she knows well -- the soft scratching of the seismograph needle across its paper cylinder.  She whacks Val on the shoulder and points speechlessly at it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Prairie dog burrow...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Little sons of bitches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The needle is going wild!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't have to explain.  All three of them dash dash for:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  BOULDER FIELD - DAY                                    57 The remains of an old rail fence lay beside one of the boulders.  Val, Earl, and Rhonda scramble over the wood, up onto the rock and stand there tensely. In a moment, the creature gently rustles the earth at the base of the rock.  The monster's slimy hook-tentacles slither out, searching the rock base.  Shuddering, the humans move as high as they can, well out of reach.  The tentacles slip back beneath the earth.  Everyone breathes a sigh of relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda points.  They can see the roof of her truck, maybe a hundred yards away through the boulders.  Val and Earl think about it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, at least the bastard can't climb.  Pardon my French.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Probably couldn't move too easily on the surface.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God, the live ones smell worse tan the dead ones.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, now, how far's your truck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.  If this one's any faster than that other one...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) I think we wait right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BOULDER FIELD - SUNSET                                 58 It's hours later.  Stiff and uncomfortable, they have nothing to do but theorize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a long pause.  Earl stares at the dirt around the rock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val gets an idea.  He grabs a post from the dilapidated fence and cautiously slips down near the boulder's edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val nods.  Dead silence as he reaches way out with the post and scrapes it on the ground.  Almost instantly the creature roars up, grabbing the post in a flurry of flying dirt and lashing tentacles, nearly hooking Val's hand.  Val practically falls over himself scrambling back to safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda stares at Val, impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all settle back, having no idea what to do next.  Rhonda gazes out at the desert that surrounds them like an ocean.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing like them in the fossil record, I'm sure...Okay, so they predate the fossil record... (not buying it herself) That'd make them a couple of billion years old...and we've just never seen one till now.  Right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd vote for outer space.  No way those are local boys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (joking) Atomic testing.  Or, no, bio- engineering!  The government built them, a big surprise in the next war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well...haven't seen a sign for hours.  Maybe it's long gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe it is.  Why don't you take a little stroll and see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck you, too.  Pardon my French.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we've got to do something .
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watch yourself!  It's got a good six foot reach.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Son of a bitch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Son of a god damned bitch!  Been waiting there all this time.  How the hell's it even know we're still here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's been listening to us.  It's got no eyes.  It sure as hell can't smell anything underground, so I figure...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course!  It can sense the slightest seismic vibration...hear every move we make.  Especially on this rock.  It's a perfect conductor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) I always wanted to be stuck on a desert island.  But somehow I always imagined, you know, water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BOULDER FIELD - NIGHT                                 58A Our heroes are silhouetted against a huge, spectacular, desert night sky.  After a very long pause:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The silhouettes shift, Val and Earl moving down one side of the rock, and Rhonda down the other.  We can no longer see them.  We just head zippers zipping down -- then soft sighs of relief from Val and Earl.  Then:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know, I hate to be crude, but I'm gonna have to take care of some business here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (emphatic) Me, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (just as emphatic) Same here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (softly) Darn it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) You okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Yeah.  But I'll tell you, if you ever wanted proof God is a man, this is it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BOULDER FIELD - DAWN                                   59 Rich orange sunlight creeps silently across the deathly still desert.  Earl is already awake.  Val is curled up without his jacket, shivering.  He wakes with a start.  Where the hell's his jacket? Rhonda wakes slowly.  She's surprised to find herself wrapped in Val's jacket.  Touched by his chivalry, she embarrassedly hands it to baffled Val.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val glances at Earl, who looks away.  Who, me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl gropes through his pockets, coming up with only cigarettes.  Val fishes in his own pockets, finding only their lighter.  They exchange items and light up during:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This time he tosses a piece of wood out onto the sand.  With soft rustling, a bulge forms in the earth, moves over to the wood, then subsides.  Rhonda starts looking around during:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda gives up on them.  She goes over and pulls a long cross rail from the fence during:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They watch in surprise as she hefts her pole, checks the balance, eyeballs the distance to the nearest boulder.  Then she charges between them, plants her pole and vaults smoothly over to the next boulder, maybe fifteen feet away.  The creature surfaces where her pole touched down, but too late
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Rhonda) No problem.  Anytime.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, folks, what's the plan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: First let's see if Stumpy's still out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't he have a home to go to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grim) Well, that's why Edgar never got down off that tower.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I might have an idea...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (ignoring her) We're gonna have to come up with some kind of plan or it's just gonna wait us to death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I was wondering if we could...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, let's just run for it.  We outran that one yesterday, at least on a sprint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Run for it?  Running's not a plan. Running is what you do when the plan fails.  You're not even trying to come up with a plan!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it's not like we've got a hell of a lot of options...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) You guys know how to pole vault?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a hook tentacle vainly sweeps the area, the disappears into the ground.  Val and Earl glance at each other, impressed .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl rushes to grab a couple more fence rails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val just stands staring across at Rhonda -- his horizons are broadening.  Earl stuffs a fence rail into his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl takes a deep breath and goes for it, vaulting across to Rhonda.  Val follows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) We just stay where it can't get us...on these residual boulders. My truck's parked right next to one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stay on those residual boulders!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (pointedly) Tammy Lynn Baxter, she do a lot of pole-vaulting?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BOULDER FIELD - WIDE SHOT - DAY                        60 Through the shimmering heat in the distance we see the strange sight of the three figures vaulting from boulder to boulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  BOULDER FIELD - RHONDA'S TRUCK - DAY                   61 Val, Earl and Rhonda pole-vault their way toward the truck. Finally they're at the nearest boulder, but the truck is still ten feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda and Val nod.  Rhonda grips her car keys in her teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all vault in unison, landing in the truck bed.  Rhonda scrambles up, slides open the cab's rear window, and begins wriggling through headfirst.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dust explodes around the rear of the truck!  Hook-tentacles snake up on all sides, narrowly missing Val.  He and Earl grab whatever's handy, pounding at the tentacles with expensive instruments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda's only half way through the cab window, still hanging headfirst into the cab.  She frantically starts the truck, dives down and punches the accelerator with her fist. As the truck roars away, one tentacles manages to tear off the the muffler.  The engine thunders like a tank.  Val and Earl sit back, sighing in relief, then react when they see Rhonda is driving upside down and blind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Think it's still following us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's assume that it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And once we hit that truck we gotta go fast.  I say we all jump together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (through clenched teeth) Ready?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.  One, two, three...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers) Come on, girl, it ain't gonna give us much time...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !  GO!  GO!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 62 Rhonda skids her noisy truck to a halt in front of Pham Van's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val leaps out and jumps into his pick-up truck.  He searches for the key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val holds out his hand for the key.  Earl tosses it to him. Val drives off.  We FOLLOW Rhonda and Earl as they drive the other way, toward Viola's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda sees straight through Earl's clumsy attempt at match- making.  She can't help but smile.  Earl grins sheepishly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We better get everybody together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You go north, I'll go south.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll bet you're sorry the college ever sent you up here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm scared, but I'm not sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, Val went to that college, too.  For a whole year.  Couldn't quite sit still for it, though. Had too much vinegar in his system. But once he settles down, forgets this cowboy stuff, he'll be one in a million.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) All right, I'm about as subtle as a donkey's ass.  Pardon my French. I'm just saying the boy's got potential, that's all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on Rhonda -- her and Val?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                  63 Nestor, Viola, Nancy, and Miguel nervously crowd around Val, Earl, and Rhonda.  Viola holds her yappy dog which perio- dically snarls and snaps at people.  Pham Van is on his CB radio trying to contact Burt and Heather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nancy rushes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody stares at her, then they smile, realizing she's pulling their legs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You serious, Val?  You think we're not even safe here in town?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ask me that after you meet one.  I think we should all get the hell out while the getting's good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not just take a Number Ten pick axe and give it one good whack...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nestor, damn it, these things are bigger than an Airstream trailer!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God, I've got to find Mindy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Pham, where's Burt and Heather?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hangs up CB) Can't raise them.  I guess they're still out there somewhere.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you've got a radio, why aren't you calling somebody in Bixby?  The police or...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can't reach outside the valley. You know, because of the mountains.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Rhonda, what's the name you call those things, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where'd they come from?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Huh?  I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a scientist, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should have a theory at least.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, these things are absolutely unprecedented!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, but where'd they come from?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (exasperated) Where'd they come from?  Okay, worms, probably in the Jurassic period.  Cosmic radiation was much higher then...so they mutated...and they got so big they just sank right into the ground and fell asleep... But now continental drift has brought them to the surface, ready to be harvested by the ancient alien meat growers who planted them here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're right, don't matter where they come from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right.  We need to be talking about what we're gonna do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My goodness, Valentine, once they see the road is out and the phone lines are down, someone will be along to look in on us.  Don't you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  CANYON ROAD - DAY                                      64 We see the utility truck still parked near the landslide blocking the road.  REVEAL, on the far side, a telephone maintenance truck is now parked, emergency lights flashing -- and nearby, amid phoneworkers' climbing and repair gear, two more hard hats lying on blood-soaked ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 65 The crowd is still jabbering away.  Rhonda speak over them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val shakes his head, and marches over to the topographic map on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The spots he indicates describe a line leading along the valley straight toward town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear an a eerie SHRIEK from outside.  Something shoots in through the window, striking Earl in the chest!!  Earl flails frantically at it -- but it's only Melvin's basketball.  We glimpse Melvin outside, doubled over with laughter.  Earl grabs the ball and hurls it viciously back, but Melvin easily dodges it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No no no, they listen !  They can sense the slightest vibration through the ground.  That's how they see!  That's how they hunt !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, like we don't vibrate, right? Maybe they won't even come to here, huh?  Maybe they leave us alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They caught up with Edgar here. They grabbed Old Fred here.  They nailed the asshole dog here.  And the doctor's place is here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) This valley's just one long smorgasbord and if we don't haul ass outta here we're the next course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You little ass wipe!  You knock that off or you're gonna be shitting that basketball!  Pardon my French.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Val) Now, Val, let's assume they're as dangerous as you say.  Where are we going to go that's safer than right here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rhonda's got an idea about that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, see, they move very easily through the Pleistocene Alluvials... (off their blank looks) ...the dirt...the loose soil that makes up the valley floor.  But they can't move through solid rock. I think we should travel west to the mountains.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, up the jeep trail.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The mountains are solid granite. We'd be safe there, and we could hike along them...all the way to Bixby if we have to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  EDGE OF TOWN - DAY                                     66 Nancy rushes back toward Pham Van's, still looking.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mindy!  Mindy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 67 We're CLOSE on Melvin as he circles around the back of Pham Van's, bouncing his basketball, mischief in his eyes.  We can hear the townsfolk inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then, to Melvin's astonishment, the steady rhythm of his bouncing basketball suddenly stops.  The ball just goes flup and doesn't bounce back up to him.  He looks down.  No ball! Just swirling dust at his feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) No, Valentine, I'm not leaving my place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Well, it's gonna take us days to get back with help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Doggone it, Viola, it's just plain crazy to stay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 68 Everyone jumps as we once more hear an ear-shattering SHRIEK from Melvin.  Earl snarls and heads for the door, Val right behind them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna kick his ass!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm gonna help you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 69 Val and Earl are well ahead of the other townsfolk as they march around to the side of Pham Van's.  But where's Melvin? Nothing out here but the oppressive, hot desert silence. Then they hear a soft shuddering whimper -- from above. There's terrified Melvin, halfway up a telephone pole, clinging to it desperately. Val and Earl freeze in their tracks and glance at each other, realizing instantly what's up.  Without a word they leap desperately in opposite directions.  Like a breaching whale, a creature roars up through the earth right where they were standing, great mouth gaping open, slimy tentacles lashing in all directions. The townsfolk scatter, some heading for their homes, including Viola and Nestor.  Others scramble over each other as they pile back into Pham Van's.  The telephone pole shudders.  Melvin falls and scampers for the nearest hiding place, a corrugated tin storage shed near Pham Van's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 70 Val, Earl, Rhonda, Miguel, and Pham Van rush in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miguel and Pham shut up.  Then we hear something new -- the building itself creaking and groaning like a ship.  The liquor bottles behind Pham Van's bar vibrate and clink.  The creature is moving beneath the building.  The people freeze like mannequins.  Now we can hear its pig-like snorting. Pham Van and Miguel react as the awful smell percolates up through the floorboards.  Val signals them to keep quiet. Finally, the creaking stops. Rhonda addresses the group in an intense whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone stands stock still -- and sweats.  But, then, slowly we become aware of a faint, yet oddly familiar sound. Squeak, squeak, squeak -- Mindy on her pogo stick!  They all scramble to the windows.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Christ!  Man, you gut a gun?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Big as a house!  What are we gonna do...?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quiet!  QUIET!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember...no noise.  No vibration.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  MAIN STREET - DAY                                      71 There she is, alone in the vacant street, Walkman blaring in her ears, merrily bouncing along to a rock 'n' roll beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thoughts of personal safety vanish as the horrified people lean way out the doors and windows and shout with one voice:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (ad lib)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! Get off your pogo stick! Get in here, girl! Run, Mindy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She can't hear them over her Walkman.  A tell-tale puff of dust spurts up not fifty feet from her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val sees Mindy has only seconds left!  He vaults straight out the window and charges toward her!  Right behind him comes Earl and Rhonda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she rounds a corner at the opposite end of town.  She spots Mindy, then sees Val running.  She starts running.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mindy!  Mindy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She's lazily bouncing in circles -- squeak, squeak, squeak. She goes wide-eyed as she rotates to see Val coming at her like a mad bull, arms outstretched.  The asphalt under her pogo stick cracks and -- Val tackles her, both of them tumbling head over heels.  She scrambles up, rubbing her skinned elbow and yelling:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val claps his hand over her mouth.  She goes wide eyed as she sees: her pogo stick standing straight up in the cracked asphalt!  Then it is sucked down like so much spaghetti! Nancy rushes into frame, hugging Mindy.  Val signals her to be quiet.  They sit uneasily.  Where's the creature? Suddenly the pogo stick erupts out of the earth right in their midst! Val runs one way, Nancy and Mindy the other, heading up the street toward their house.  Val scrambles up onto his pick-up truck!  The creature rams the truck, rupturing a tire.  As it shakes the truck violently, Val spots Rhonda and Earl, now standing uncertainly halfway between him and Pham Van's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda and Earl hesitate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Earl now hears something behind them!  Down the street, a little wall of cinder blocks framing Viola's driveway suddenly topples over.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oww!  Val, you hurt me...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go back, for chrissake!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We gotta get him off there.  It'll suck that truck down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, Jesus.  Rhonda, another one!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - RHONDA AND EARL                         77 CAMERA charges toward them.  Earl swerves toward Pham Van's, but Rhonda is cut off!  She heads toward the next nearest haven:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  STORAGE SHED - DAY                                     78 The storage shed where Melvin is hiding.  It sits in a vacant, weed-choked lot.  Crashing through the weeds, Rhonda has almost reached the shed when she is suddenly brought up short and slams face down in a cloud of dust! She can't get up!!  Something's got her!  She's caught in an old rusted barbed wire fence, lying almost flat, hidden in the weeds.  Some strands have come loose and are curled up like vicious concertina wire. Barely has she taken this in when -- the ground caves in under her!  She rolls wildly to one side as hook-tentacles snake up, missing her by inches!  She keeps rolling-crawling- scrambling -- anything to get away from the awful maw -- but gets her legs hopelessly tangled in the barbed wire.  She freezes.  The creature feels around where she was. She calms herself, pulling gingerly at the wire, working tensely to free herself but -- The creature's mouth slams shut on the fence.  Like a spider sensing something caught in its web, the monster knows it's on to something.  Its hook-tentacles shoot forward to snare three feet of fence, then the creature lunges up and out, swallowing that three feet in a big "gulp" and yanking Rhonda violently toward it!  She screams, pants ripped, legs slashed and bleeding!  GULP!  She's dragged even closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  MAIN STREET - THE PICK-UP - DAY                        79 The truck shakes and shimmies as Val's creature tries to pull it down.  Val sees that Rhonda's in trouble.  He searches frantically for a weapon -- and finds one -- a CHAIN SAW!  He leaps as far from the truck as he can and hits the ground running, yanking furiously on the saw's starter cord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  STORAGE SHED - DAY                                     80 Rhonda is in a dead panic, thrashing helplessly in the barbed wire.  The beast takes another gulp of fence, wrenching her within inches of a probing hook-tentacle!  Suddenly we hear a nasty ROAR as Val's chain saw swings in, slicing the squirm- ing tentacle in half, spraying gore everywhere!  The creature unleashes an unearthly shriek, and the other tentacles recoil.  The severed one writhes like a beheaded snake. Val yanks off Rhonda's boots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She frantically claws at her belt.  But in mere seconds:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tentacles snake out to regain their grip on the fence.  Val grabs the saw and starts slashing wildly, but this time the hook-tentacles snag it and wrench it from his grasp.  It slams to the ground, motor dying.  The monster readies itself for the lunge that will suck Rhonda in.  Val grabs her under the arms and pulls.  Rhonda wriggles wildly to get out of her wire enmeshed pants. The creature lunges!  Rhonda pulls free!  She and Val tumble backward.  The creature gets only a mouthful of Rhonda's jeans. The next instant the second creature explodes up through the ground right next to fallen Val and Rhonda!  They roll sideways, come up running, and sprint for Pham Van's along an old wooden sidewalk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on!  Outta your pants!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 81 Earl flings open the front door.  Val and Rhonda race toward the porch.  Right on their heels the creature ripples the boards like an ocean wave!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They dive through the open door of Pham Van's.  The rippling boards zoom on past it.  Earl quickly eases the door shut.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on!  Come on!  Don't look back! Just run!  Run like screaming fuck!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 82 Earl turns to breathless Rhonda.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers) Pardon my French.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - LATER                               83 It's a tense, edgy group.  Every movement made is in slow motion, every word is a whisper.   They gaze grimly out the windows at the silent, deserted, heat-shimmering main street. Val gingerly dabs iodine onto the cuts on Rhonda's legs. She doesn't even wince.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gazes at him.  He looks away.  Over at the bar, Pham holds up a new pair of pants for Rhonda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grateful for something to do, Val eases over to get the pants.  Rhonda looks after him.  Then she becomes aware of someone staring at her .  It's Earl, giving her a big Cheshire cat grin that says "What did I tell you?" Pham hands the pants to Val.  Then Pham and Miguel reach simultaneously for a sods bottle and -- knock it over!  It rolls all the way down the bar as a flurry of desperate hands try to stop it.  No good.  It rolls off the end and -- CRASH! Everyone freezes.  Sure enough the building shudders.  Floor boards creak and bend as searching tentacles thump and scrape along under the floor.  People close their eyes, not even breathing.  Finally the noise subsides.  Everyone relaxes -- a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all shut up when they hear Viola's dog yapping in the distance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You paying attention?  This oughta hurt like hell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It does.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) So, is that one of your usual jobs, saving peoples' lives?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (embarrassed) First time for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what are we gonna do, you know? How long till they go away?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head) They got the patience of Job.  They just sit and goddamn wait til they hear something that sounds like lunch.  We need a plan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got a plan.  You and Val take your truck, get to the mountains. Hike to Bixby.  Get us some help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Those scumsuckers are my radials, Pham!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we can take my truck then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No good.  You need major four- wheel-drive just to get up that jeep trail.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  VIOLA'S TRAILER - DAY                                  84 Up the hill across from Pham Van's, the old trailer looks perfectly peaceful.  Except Viola's dog keeps yapping.  Then we hear panicked Viola.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Quiet!  Quiet you hateful thing...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 85 EARL Shut it up!  Shut the little bastard up!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Chuck him out the door!  Like a little hors d'oeuvre.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We hear a loud whap!  The dog's bark simply changes to piercing yelps.  It would be funny except -- The trailer suddenly bucks upward, hit from below as though by a pile driver!  Again and again the unseen creatures slam into the frail structure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trailer is finally knocked right off its foundation!  It tips over and tumbles all the way down the hill!  As the dust clears, all is silent.  A huge hole is torn in the trailer's floor.  Viola's possessions are scattered everywhere.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Get away!  Get away!  Oh God in heaven, help me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 86 Everyone stares in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone turns away from the windows, gingerly sitting down, glumly pondering this possibility.  There is a long silence. Then suddenly -- ROAR!  The silence is shattered as Pham Van's big freezer compressor suddenly comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pham runs to the freezer.  Its on/off switch is buried behind stacks of soft-drink cases.  He tears at them like a madman, toppling them this way and that.  Earl and Val join him. But right behind Pham, the floor BUCKLES UP, a monster's snout BURSTING THROUGH and engulfing one of his legs!  The creature starts to back down into the jagged hole, dragging screaming Pham with it.  Val, Earl, Rhonda, and Miguel grab Pham's arms but are no match for the monster.  It shakes and spins him like some gigantic dog, effortlessly throwing them off, relentlessly pulling Pham down. The hole in the floor is too small for Pham to fit through ! As one leg goes down, the other is bent hideously backward. Pham screams and screams as jagged wood tears into him, bones snap, ribs crack.  The others grab him again but are utterly helpless.  With vicious, powerful jerks the creature yanks his man mangled body down.  The last thing we see is his foot, now folded back past his head, and he's gone. Val is wild with helpless anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The floor bulges up in another place!  A second creature! Then a third, coming RIGHT UP UNDER THEM!  Earl sprawls onto the bar.  Rhonda springs onto the shelves in the middle of the store, knocking groceries everywhere.  Val and Miguel climb up shelves which cover the rear wall of the store. The whole building shakes and shudders, dust powdering down from the ceiling.  Flailing tentacles are everywhere, slashing open food packages; clouds of flour fill the air! Val spots a hatch in the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl leaps from the bar to the rear shelves.  Val and Miguel slide sideways till they're beneath the hatch, then use the shelves as a ladder, climbing up to the hatch.  Val pounds on it frantically. In the middle of the store, Rhonda leaps from shelf to shelf, trying to get closer to where Val is.  Soon she reaches the last one, balancing precariously.  But a creature tips over the first one!  The shelves topple like dominoes, crashing toward Rhonda.  She is half catapulted, half jumps right through an open window, ripping through the screen. Val sees what's happened.  With maniacal strength he smashes open the hatch and climbs out onto -- 87    EXT.  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          87 Val rushes to the edge of the roof shouting:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks down where Rhonda fell.  She's not there.  He hears a whistle and is relieved to see:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Son of a bitchin' lowlife, putrid, scum...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gotta do something.  Gotta get the bastards!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hopeless) Man, what the hell can we do to those things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we're sure as hell not going to sit here being quiet for God knows how long.  Are we?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now wait a minute, Earl.  I got enough food here to last us for weeks.  Those damn things can't wait around forever. (pause) We can do it.  I mean, if we have to, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus!  Shut it off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Son of a bitch!  Son of a bitch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Everybody!  This way!  The roof!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rhonda!  Keep moving.  Don't stop!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  WATER TOWER - DAY                                      88 Rhonda is perched as high as she can get on the water tower near Pham Van's.  It's maybe twenty-five feet tall, a simple wood frame holding a big galvanized tank.  The wooden legs stand on big concrete anchors buried in the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  STORAGE SHED - DAY                                     89 Melvin peers terrified out the shed door, up at the guys on Pham Van's roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too late.  Wham!  A creature strikes.  The little shed shudders, dust puffing from every old seam.  In a split second Melvin has climbed to the shed roof.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey!  What's going on, man?!  What the hell you doing up there...?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Melvin, shut the hell up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  NANCY'S HOUSE - DAY                                    90 Nancy and Mindy peer to the window, surprised to see the men on Pham Van's roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PERFECTION - WIDE - DAY                                91 We hear Val's shouting to the remaining townsfolk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nancy!  Nestor!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          92 VAL Get up on your roof!  On your roof! They can come through the floor! The store shakes and shimmies.  We hear the monster's thunderous crashing from below.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Can't you shout a little quieter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BURT & HEATHER'S HOUSE - DAY                           93 Burt and Heather's place, about a mile from town, is no- nonsense, functional, ugly -- unpainted concrete walls, no yard, chain-link fence.  Burt and Heather drive up in their big Blazer and park right beside the house.  Hot and tired, they climb out, each carrying a heavy, scoped hunting rifle. Burt peers toward Perfection through binoculars during:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't believe it.  No tracks, no sign, no spoor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, whatever they are, you'd think after they ate all those sheep they'd have to take a dump someplace... (reacts to what he sees) What the hell's going on in town?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PERFECTION - TELEPHOTO - BURT'S P.O.V. - DAY           94 The town is a very strange sight.  It's as though an invisible flood were in progress, driving people to high ground.  We see: Rhonda perched on the water tower; Val, Earl and Miguel on the store roof; Nancy and Mindy on their roof; Melvin on the storage shed; Nestor on his roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          95 Val, Earl and Miguel gaze out at the town, trying to concoct a plan.   Suddenly Earl perks up.  The men speak softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val stares at him, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly, down in the store, Pham Van's CB radio squawks loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The building shudders as the creatures again smash through the floor inside, looking for the source of the noise.  Val, Earl and Miguel scramble to the edge of the roof.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, here's the plan: Nestor's Cadillac.  His tires are nine hundred sixteens.  We sprint for it, grab the spare, put it on our truck with our spare.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How the hell long it take you to change a tire?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs) Just about too damn long.  Bolt pattern's probably wrong anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We need another plan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Yo, P.V., Burt here.  Come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 96 The CB radio sits on a shelf near an open window.  Tentacles are feeling along the wall just below it.  Val appears out- side the window -- upside-down.  He snatches the radio and is hauled straight up out of frame.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Pham?  Anybody copy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          97 Miguel and Earl haul Val by the feet back up onto the roof. Val quickly turns down the CB volume.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (whispers into mic) Burt, now listen.  We found out what's been killing people.  Over?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BURT & HEATHER'S HOUSE - BASEMENT - DAY                98 A peculiar cross between bomb shelter and blue-collar den, Burt's wood-paneled basement has all the comforts for post- Apocalypse living.  Burt talks on his CB.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A few feet away Heather works at their ammunition reloading bench.  She dumps a few hundred empty cartridge cases into a case cleaner and switches it on.  It HUMS loudly as it vibrates.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Negative copy on that, Pham, check your frequency.  I'm on forty-nine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (a little louder) Burt, can you hear me now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just barely, Pham.  What are you all doing up on your roofs. What the hell's going on?  Come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - DAY                                 99 The groping tentacles swiftly suck back below the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP to see out the window some distance away, a couple of old trash cans topple over as the creature streaks past beneath them, making a bee-line for Burt's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          100 Miguel points frantically at the trash cans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val talks a little louder into the mic.  INTERCUT as needed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh man, they're going, man!  I think they're going for Burt!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Burt!  This is Val!  Get out of your basement!!  Take your radio! You and Heather get up on your roof!  Then we'll talk, okay?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Val?  What the hell you doing back already?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) Burt, get out!  Get up on your roof or someplace!  We found out what's been killing people!  They're under the ground!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) What's under the ground?  We're not getting up on the roof.  Earth shelter's the best.  Known that since I was a kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen!  Listen!  We know what they are!  They're big things under the ground!  Much bigger than we thought!  They're coming after you! They're coming right now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BURT & HEATHER'S HOUSE - BASEMENT - DAY                101 Hearing that warning, Burt and Heather go into a well-honed drill.  They grab their hunting rifles and take positions at basement windows.  Burt scans with the binoculars.  He sees nothing.  He glances at Heather.  She shrugs.  Nobody coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val is frantic.  How do you explain these things?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt and Heather exchange looks.  Has Val gone nuts?  Then they hear a low RUMBLE, growing louder and louder.  Tools hanging over the work bench start to shake; the decorative cow skulls on the wall rattle; the overhead lights sway -- and then -- everything stops.  Dead silence, except for the humming of the case cleaner.
direction.name: direction
