dialogue.raw_text: (into CB) We don't see anything, Val.  Now what the hell are you talking about?  Over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) They're coming under ground!  They ...they can dig like a son of a bitch...Big monsters under the ground, Burt!  Now get the hell out!  Hurry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !!  The wood paneling bulges slightly. Nails pop out.  The wall is pushed again; the paneling cracks.  A cow skull falls.  Burt and Heather level their rifles and -- A huge creature pushes right through the wall!  Fully half its bulbous, spiked body writhes into the center of the room, great multi-part jaws drooling open, hook-tentacles lashing out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          102 The three men can hear the chaos over the CB.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CB goes dead.  The men stare numbly.  Then, drifting across the desert, a soft popping sound.  The men perk up; they know what it is -- distant gunfire.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Jesus Chri...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BURT & HEATHER'S HOUSE - BASEMENT - DAY                103 The gunfire is DEAFENING as Burt and Heather blast away. Globby blood spurts from a dozen wounds, and the creature pulls back a little.  The couple keeps firing until magazines are empty.  The creature lunges forward again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with Burt and Heather to REVEAL a wall of the basement we haven't seen until now -- a wall covered with guns -- hand guns, long guns, riot guns, flare guns, antique guns, military guns, elephant guns. Heather grabs an HK-91 assault rifle, slams in two magazines, bottoms taped end to end, and opens fire!  A hook-tentacle snags her boot, yanking her right off her feet.  Burt pumps out eight devastating blasts from a twelve-gauge riot gun, severing the tentacle.  Heather is on her feet in an instant. She expertly flops her double magazine over, loading the full one taped upside-down to it, and opens fire again.  Burt grabs an AR-15 semi-auto and joins her.  They lay down massive fire, virtually disappearing in muzzle flash and smoke.  Ejected shell cases clatter and clang all around the room. The guns are empty.  THE CREATURE IS STILL COMING!  They back down the wall, desperately grabbing weapons one after another: a lever-action, a magnum handgun, even a flare gun which Heather fires right into the creature's mouth. Shrieking in pain, the horrid thing thing KEEPS WRIGGLING TOWARD THEM! Burt and Heather scramble up over a desk to keep something between them and it.  Burt smashes open a fancy glass case holding a huge four-gauge elephant gun.  He slams in two gigantic cartridges nearly an inch in diameter.  He fires. The concussion literally shakes the building.  The recoil slams Burt back against the wall. The monster bullets tear monster holes in the monster.  Great gouts of curdles blood spew from it -- Burt hit an artery or something.  The beast convulses grotesquely, then collapses, deflating like a beached whale.  Burt and Heather stagger together and hug each other fervently.  They stare dumbfounded at the massive dead horror.  Burt suddenly shouts vehemently:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Broke into the wrong goddamn rec room, didn't you, you BASTARD!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          104 Val, Earl and Miguel listen to the silence hoping for some sign that their friends are alive.  Suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It takes a moment for this to sink in, then the men CHEER -- as quietly as possible.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O. filter) We killed it !  You got that?  We killed that motherfucker!  Come back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh...roger that, Burt.  Uh, congratulations.  Uh, be advised, however, there are four more, repeat, four more motherfuckers. Come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BURT & HEATHER'S HOUSE - ROOF - DAY                    105 Burt and Heather dash out onto the roof, laden with weapons, ammo boxes and their CB radio.  They hit the deck, assorted rifles and the elephant gun the ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          106 Val shouts to everyone:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They got one!  They killed one of the sons of bitches!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  STORAGE SHED - ROOF - DAY                              107 Melvin pumps his fist in the air.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Way to go, dudes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . THE STERNGOOD HOUSE - ROOF - DAY                        108 Nancy and Mindy hug each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  NESTOR'S HOUSE - ROOF - DAY                            109 Perched on his Spanish tile roof, Nestor pours coffee from his thermos and raises his cup in a toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  WATER TOWER - DAY                                      110 Rhonda lets out a WHOOP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          111 The men sit, temporarily jubilant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val grabs the CB mic.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I guess we don't get to make fun of Burt's lifestyle anymore, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Burt, any chance you can get the rest of them?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BURT & HEATHER'S HOUSE - ROOF - DAY                    112 Burt and Heather peer from their fortress-like roof.  Burt spots earth bulging up near the foundation of his house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs the elephant gun and takes two well-aimed shots -- two deafening BOOMS which echo off the distant mountains. But the bullets bury themselves harmlessly in the dirt.  The bulge in the dirt moves calmly away and sinks from view. Heather shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into CB) One second, Val.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not getting any penetration, even with the elephant gun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn! (into CB) Val, we can't get them.  Never figured on having to shoot through dirt!  Best goddamn bullet stop there is.  Come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          113 The men are disappointed.  That's not what they wanted to hear from Burt.  Then Earl perks up and grab the CB mic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Rhonda interrupts, pointing urgently from the water tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val, Earl and Miguel rush to the edge of the roof and look down where she's pointing -- A creature is running its tentacles along the building's foundation.  It's a strange, more studied movement than we've seen before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all stare nervously down as the tentacles feel their way along the wall, moving toward a corner of the building. Suddenly Miguel spots something down the next wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another set of tentacles is feeling along the adjacent wall. The two creatures meet at the corner, their tentacles touch- ing rather like ants' antennae.  They they submerge; tenta- cles zipping into the earth.  Nothing happens for a moment. Then the corner of the building suddenly heaves up a couple of feet.  Clapboard siding splits.  A warped window shatters. (We don't see the creatures, only the effect of their shoving from below).  The men nearly lose their balance.  Then the corner sinks back down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into CB) Okay, Burt, listen.  Forget shooting them.  Tell me this: can you get to your truck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) No problem.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good.  You've got the only truck in the valley that can make it up that damn jeep trail.  So, here's the plan: You and Heather go for help. Get to the mountains...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, guys!  They're up to something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Rhonda) What's it doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you all keep asking me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, there's another one coming!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell was that all about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  NANCY'S HOUSE - DAY                                    114 Nancy and Mindy are still huddled on the roof.  They don't make a sound.  They're startled when the house suddenly groans and tilts as creatures give it a tentative shove. Nancy and Mindy frantically cling to the peak of the smooth roof.  The picture windows shatters.  We hear beams POP and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: dishes CRASH off shelves.  The front screen door swings open.  At last the house slowly settles back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          115 The men are watching Nancy's house tensely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda chimes in from the water tower.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They weren't making no noise. Why they bothering them for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mind racing) They're studying the buildings... trying to figure them out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, they're confused.  They can feel our vibrations, but they can't find us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're working together, too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, like they got a plan...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Breaker there, Earl.  What do you want us to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into CB) Hang on, Burt.  The bastards are up to something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  NESTOR'S HOUSE - ROOF - DAY                            116 Straddling the peak of his steeply sloping roof.  Nestor grabs on in panic as the creatures lift the place up slowly! The roof warps, Spanish tiles shatter and rain down on the ground. This causes a flurry of activity.  Tentacles snake around where the tiles fell.  We hear creatures crash through inside, snorting and huffing.  They attack the house in earnest, shaking it violently, pushing the front wall out till it falls flat.  The roof collapses on that side!  Nestor can't hang on!  He slides all the way down, landing across a window on the flattened wall.  The next instant he's grabbed and pulled through the window, right into the ground.  He
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: along the ground, heading toward the storage shed where Melvin is.  All we can see is dirt, but we can still hear Nestor screaming UNDERGROUND!  His screams get more and more faint as DOLLY ENDS on:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  STORAGE SHED - DAY                                     117 CLOSE ON horrified Melvin as he rocks back and forth autistically.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, wow, man!  No way!  No fucking way, man...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  NANCY'S HOUSE - ROOF - DAY                             118 Nancy comforts Mindy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  WATER TOWER - DAY                                      119 Rhonda turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM CAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          120 Val, Earl and Miguel stare in horror and disbelief.  Miguel crosses himself.  They're in worse trouble than they thought.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They knocked his place down on purpose, man.  They're gonna tear this whole town out from under us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BURT & HEATHER'S HOUSE - DAY                           121 Burt and Heather's truck is parked in foreground.  The couple is up on the roof in background.  Burt prowls along the edge of the roof with the elephant gun.  Heather mans the C.B.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hump of dirt raises near the base of the house.  Burt jerks the rifle to his shoulder and squeezes off a shot.  The hump moves away from the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still moving away, the hump of dirt passes under the side- walk, rippling the flagstones gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hump of dirt passes under Burt and Heather's truck, rocking the vehicle slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The truck's security alarm starts BOOPING!  Burt and Heather stare down helplessly as the noisy truck is furiously attacked by the frenzied creatures.  Dust flies as metal rips and tires shred.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Burt!  Heather!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, Val.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) We're in deep shit over here. Let's change that plan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Knock it off, Burt!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I scared it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Forget going for help.  We'll all be dead long before you get back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into CB) We're here, Val.  Just tell us what you need.  Come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) They're tearing down the houses here!  We all gotta get outta here together!  Now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're with you, Val.  We'll come get everybody.  Just hang on tight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  PHAM VAN'S STORE - ROOF - DAY                          122 Val Earl and Miguel listen in disbelief to the distant truck alarm.  It finally sputters and dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've hit rock-bottom.  They sit in helpless, desperate silence. Over on the storage shed roof, Melvin is losing it:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miguel nods in agreement.  Val and Earl stare at him, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val just stares at her. Then -- CRASH!  The store shudders, creaks, and groans.  The creatures are back.  One corner of the store lifts up, beams splintering.  Then another corner lifts up!  The roof tilts like the deck of a storm-tossed ship.  From now on the monsters shake and ram the building almost constantly. Hanging on tight, the men peer over the edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meanwhile, Rhonda tries her desperate best to be logical:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Val is warming to the idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They squint at the bulldozer -- ' way in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stare grimly, momentarily stuck for an idea.  Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miguel grabs Earl and points down at little garden tractor in a jumble of Pham Van's equipment and tools near the side of the store.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The store takes a heavy hit.  The front porch collapses with a terrific crash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val scrambles to the highest point of the sagging roof and shouts to Nancy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Val, we're going to have to forget about the truck...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  BULLDOZER - DAY                                        147 Val has used heavy chains on the back of the bulldozer to jerry-rig a hitch to the semi trailer.   Now he scrambles back into the driver's seat.  He guns the engine, wrenching the old semi trailer from years of dried mud and tumbleweeds. Ancient tires disintegrate.  Rusted wheels screech and complain -- but it moves.  Val lets out a whoop and heads full-tilt for town.  He's suddenly shocked as he sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  WATER TOWER - DAY                                      148 Rhonda's in big trouble.  She scrambles to the high side of the tower platform.  The tower's going to tip over at any moment!  It's roof slides off and crashes into the street! On Pham Van's, Miguel and Earl are tearing apart the swamp cooler, throwing pieces of it off the roof, trying to distract the creatures, but they can't compete with the noise from the water. In BG the bulldozer rumbles toward the tower at top speed -- an excruciatingly slow eight miles per hour. The tremendously heavy water tank suddenly tears loose, sliding off its platform, nearly carrying Rhonda with it. She ends up hanging from a cross beam as the water tank splatters like an enormous egg below, sending a small tidal wave down the street. The remains of the tower tilt crazily nearly forty-five degrees.  The bulldozer grinds closer and closer.  Rhonda tries to climb up, but the jostling and shuddering of the tower keeps her dangling precariously.  Suddenly she falls! And lands in the dirt.  The creatures zero in on her!  She turns wildly and leaps for the blade of the approaching bulldozer.  The blade is only inches off the ground but Val swiftly raises it, lifting Rhonda high into the air just above the grasping tentacles!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  PERFECTION - MAIN STREET - DAY                         149 As Rhonda climbs down into the cab, Val heads the bulldozer over to Pham Van's and stops.  Almost as soon as he does, creatures attack, a frenzy of tentacles grabbing at all sides of the massive earth-moving machine, slithering into the treads.  Val and Rhonda watch this nervously as Earl and Miguel quickly clamber from the roof down into the protective steel belly of the semi trailer. Val mentally crosses his fingers and sends the bulldozer roaring forward.  It effortlessly tears loose from the tentacles, grinding one to pulp in its treads.  The creature shrieks in pain.  The humans cheer!  At last they've got the upper hand!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  STORAGE SHED - DAY                                     150 Melvin dances merrily, and noisily , on the metal rooftop.

direction.raw_text: The flimsy shed seems almost to explode as a furious creature roars up inside.  The walls buckle out.  The whole structure sags.  Melvin scrambles to peak of the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the unseen creature thrashes around inside the shed, the walls topple outward and the roof drops to the ground like a pancake.  Melvin has lost all self control and just keeps screaming.  Val pulls along side, jumps down onto the tread, and reaches out to Melvin.  But just as they join hands, the creature hits the roof from beneath, dragging it several feet.  Val is yanked off the bulldozer and lands with Nelvin on the roof! The creature slams into the roof repeatedly, but the corrugated metal is both light and resilient.  It bends, but the frustrated monster can't get enough "bite" to tear through it.  Val and Melvin straddle the peak of the roof, trying desperately to hang on as it heaves up, buckling like a bronco. Earl scrambles into the bulldozer driver's seat and heads after them at full throttle, the big diesel roaring. Melvin and Val prepare to jump onto the bulldozer, but just before it reaches them the roof suddenly starts to slide like some mad flying carpet, carried from beneath by a creature! Val hangs on like a rodeo rider, struggling to keep fear- crazed Melvin from tumbling off.
direction.name: direction

Earl does his best to head it off, but it's hard to predict which way the roof will scoot next. The rood careens alongside the edge of a dirt-walled drainage ditch, then suddenly skitters sideways and plunges over the edge.  Melvin and Val tumble to the bottom.  As they jump to their feet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val sees, almost right above them, an exposed pipe which spans the ditch.  He shoves Melvin toward it.  They leap up and grab the pipe, pulling their legs up as high as they can. An instant later, the creature blasts through one wall of the ditch, roars past beneath them and burrows into the opposite wall! Earl brings the bulldozer to a thundering stop next to them.

result.heading: THE BULLDOZER PLUNGES NOSE FIRST INTO AN UNSEEN PIT DUG JUST BENEATH THE SURFACE

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - BULLDOZER - DAY                               160 We watch the bulldozer rumbling along.  It seems unstop- able.  The mountains and safety are barely a mile away -- when the EARTH CAVES IN!!  THE BULLDOZER PLUNGES NOSE FIRST INTO AN UNSEEN PIT DUG JUST BENEATH THE SURFACE! The machine ends up half-buried at a steep angle.  The semi trailer is right on the edge of the pit.  Everyone is shaken, bruised, bloodied.  Val, Earl and Rhonda look frantically for Burt, who was riding out front in the scoop.  They're relieved to see him clawing his way out of pit.  Val hauls him up and all four of them now leap into the semi trailer. As they come to rest, Val slowly realizes what's happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The idling bulldozer engine coughs and dies.  There is a moment's crushing silence. Then the dreaded digging begins.  Dust boils up around the semi trailer -- creatures digging from below!  The semi trailer shakes and shudders, slowly sinking.  The people huddle together in sheer panic.  Val and Earl grab the nearest of Burt and Heather's guns and fire wildly, hope- lessly, down at the dirt.  Ricochets whine into the distance. Burt grimly digs an overloaded knapsack for one of his pipe bombs.  He leaps up between Val and Earl and lights the fuse, looking for a target.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tosses the bomb at some churning earth and dives back into the semi trailer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !  The explosion throws up a big plume of dust and rocks.  We hear a new , very strange sound of pain from the creatures.  The semi trailer instantly stops shaking.  The creatures have stopped digging.  All is quiet. The people peer up over the edge of the semi trailer, looking all around.  Then:

direction.raw_text: Val squats in front of tear-streaked Mindy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Burt readies another bomb, he pauses to hand bug-eyed Melvin a huge Ruger Super Redhawk 44 magnum handgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Melvin's eyes bug out further.  Burt lights his bomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hurls the bomb.  Wait.  Wait.  WHOOOM!  Again we hear the creatures' unearthly shriek of pain.  Rhonda's on her feet before the rocks stop falling.  She spots the creatures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl lets out a war wild WHOOP.  It's infectious.  CRANE UP with them as everyone piles out of the semi trailer like soldiers out of a trench -- they charge across no-man's-land. Melvin runs like a demon.  He tries to shoot at the first thing he sees but the gun just clicks over and over -- empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enraged, he doubles his speed, trying to overtake Burt. Mindy can't keep up.  Nancy tries to pull her along.  Val and Earl swoop in, grab Mindy under either arm, and carry her between them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here they come!  They're coming back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, everybody!  We gotta run for those rocks over there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus, Val, it's pretty far.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, man!  They'll get us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There sure as hell get us if we stay here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, wait, listen.  Burt do you have any more of those things?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The bombs?  Damn right I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, what is you throw one that way, the way we want to go... (points toward rocks) Then, when the explosion happens... if it drives them away again...we all run like goddamn bastards! (to Earl) Pardon my French.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if it doesn't scare them? What if they don't run?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think it does scare them! It hurts them!  They're  so sensitive to sound, they have to run!  It hurts too much!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's got my vote.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right.  We're gonna run.  Get ready.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Mindy, you understand what we're going to do? (off her nod) And don't worry, they can't get us once we're on those rocks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know, man.  They're too fast!  You can't outrun them, no way!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here, kid.  This'll make'em think twice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) Heads down!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It worked!  There they go!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Burt, you bastard!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The ground heaves violently as the retreating monsters angrily wheel about and charge back after the humans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - ROCK OUTCROP - DAY                            166 Big slabs jutting this way and that -- a rock iceberg in a sand ocean.  The people scramble onto it amid whoops of joy and relief.  Melvin charges up to Burt:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt's line gets a laugh from people, but then tentacles burst up on all sides of the rock, probing, feeling.  The effect is instantly sobering.  Burt swiftly grabs out his remaining bombs -- six of them -- and holds one ready.  But they're in no immediate danger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hopelessness of the situation suddenly hits Val, Earl, and Rhonda.  After a moment:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As this sinks in, Burt loses his cool, igniting an argument.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone stares in surprise at normally quiet Nancy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a long, grim silence.  Everyone sits glumly. Finally, Burt picks up a bomb and contemplates it:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heather puts a soothing hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now Earl brightens a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others react.  Is Earl nuts?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You asshole!  There's no bullets in this gun!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Got you moving, didn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So...now what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could we make it to the mountains?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gestures to Burt's bombs) No way.  We'd need fifty of those things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well...that's it.  We're not getting off this rock...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not going to pole vault anywhere. That's for sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter with you?  What are you talking about?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They'll just wait out there till we're dead.  That's what they do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?  Well, for chrissake, we could have made a stand at our place!  We had food, water...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't fight'em that way...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You two jackasses hauled us way the hell out here...!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, who put you two in charge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) Burt!  Those animals would have killed you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cont'd) (softly) You haven't seen what they can do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (calmer) They'd have dug your place out from under you in half an hour!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (losing it) If it comes to starvation, I know what I'm doing.  Take one of these. Walk right out there with the fuse lit.  Stuff it down my pants and let 'em take me down. BOOOOM !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus, honey!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, that's not a bad idea!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I mean, it gives me an idea... going fishing like...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - ROCK OUTCROP - LATER                          167 In the open desert, a rock lands.  Then another.  Val and Rhonda are throwing them from the rock outcrop. Val, Earl, Rhonda, and Burt have moved away from the main group to another section of the rock outcrop where intervening boulders will protect everyone from an explosion. Earl has tied a bomb to some nylon rope form one of Burt's knapsacks.  Burt places the other bombs safely out of the way behind a ledge.  Meanwhile, Val and Rhonda keep throwing rocks.  Soon, the ground shifts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt has his coil of fuse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt nods, expertly eyeballing a fifteen second length and snipping it off.  As he stuffs it into the bomb:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bomb is ready -- it's moment of truth.  Earl digs in his pocket for the lighter -- but Val has it.  Val nervously leans over to light the fuse, but then frowns as he sees how Earl is holding the rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val shakes his head and lights the fuse.  Earl whirls the bomb on the end of its rope like a lasso, and lets it fly out as far as he can.  Then he starts pulling it back in along the ground like a fishing lure.  Rhonda stares at her watch as they all sink down behind the protective boulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly a snout subtly surfaces and gulps down the bomb.  A tense two seconds later -- KABOOOM!  Bullseye!  It's a volcano of gory creature parts.  They splatter all over!  The remaining creatures shriek and race away again.  The people cheer wildly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There!  Right straight out in front of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know...  They're pretty quick...fifteen seconds?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is that, anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cannon fuse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you use it for?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (matter of fact) My cannon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, you're not going to do your lasso thing...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, just 'cause you're no good with a rope...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on...come on...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take it...take the bait...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  DESERT - ROCK OUTCROP - LATER                          168 Val, Earl, Rhonda, and Burt prepare to try again.  This time Val has the rope and a new bomb.  Rhonda stands by him, ready with the lighter.  Earl lobs rocks out into the desert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhonda shakily lights the fuse.  Val heaves the bomb out and starts trolling.  The creature swallows it.  Everyone drops down behind the boulder, Val impulsively grabbing a second bomb. They tense with anticipatory glee -- but the creature suddenly spits its bomb back out !  It sails back right over their heads.  It strikes the rocks above them, skittering down a crevice and landing in -- BURT'S PILE OF BOMBS! Val, Earl, and Rhonda scatter.  Burt dives backward over a rock ledge.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where the hell are they?  Hope they didn't wise up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) Nope, there!  That's one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !!  All the bombs explode, throwing rocks every- where.  The creatures streak away.  Val, Earl and Rhonda sprawl into the dirt, half stunned. When the panic is over, Val and Earl realize where they are -- fifty yards out in open desert!  So is Rhonda, off at an angle from them!  Only Burt is safe on the rock outcrop. And the creatures are coming back fast! The stranded trio starts back for the outcrop, but the creatures burst up ahead of them -- one blocking Rhonda's path, the other two cutting Val and Earl off!  The creatures roar toward their easy prey! Val and Earl freeze.  The ground bulges as the creatures "skid" to a halt not ten feet from them.  Rhonda stands stock still some fifty feet away, eyeing her own creature. Over on the outcrop with the main group of people Heather sizes up the situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone starts hopping up and down, yelling, screaming, and clapping.  Burt even runs a few feet out from the rocks, firing a pistol into the dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crowd keeps up the ruckus.  The creatures are distracted by the noise, but this time they don't automatically go after it.  Their big snouts turn uncertainly this way and that. But they just stay where they are.  Their hook-tentacles slide out, feeling all around.  Earl whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heather takes careful aim with her elephant gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But before she can fire, the creatures mysteriously sink from view.  Val, Rhonda, and Earl remain frozen.  What the hell is going on?  Nothing happens -- then -- A HUGE HUMP OF EARTH suddenly wells up near Rhonda.  It sinks back down as fast as it appeared.  It's like the creature suddenly lifted its whole body almost to the surface then submerged again.  Another hump rises and falls right near Val and Earl.  There's a pause as the men whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The creatures try another random "barrage" of humps, some coming perilously close.  They know they'll eventually topple their prey.  One comes so close to Val and Earl that pebbles roll down its sides into their boots!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More humps rise and fall.  Val gives in.  He signals Rhonda, gesturing with the bomb.  She understands.  He'll set it off, driving away the creatures, and they'll all run back to the outcrop. Val digs for the lighter.  Doesn't have it.  Earl digs for it, too.  But he doesn't have it either!  They go dead pale. How can that be?  They look across fifty feet of deadly open ground -- trembling Rhonda holds up the lighter! Over on the outcrop, Burt shouts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Val signals to Rhonda to throw the lighter.  She nods.  But just before she does, A HUMP STARTS RISING DIRECTLY UNDER HER!  She fights to keep her balance -- struggling to keep from taking that single step which will instantly tell the creatures where she is. But there's no hope.  The hump jerks higher.  Her boots slip down the gravelly side!  Instantly the creature twists toward her, its hungry mouth erupting out of the dirt.  She screams and dashes for Val and Earl.  They run to meet her.  The other creatures surface.  The trio is cut off from the rock outcrop! Val and Earl link up with Rhonda and they all run madly while Rhonda tries to light Val's bomb fuse.  But suddenly Val yanks the bomb away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He veers off in a new direction.  Startled Earl and Rhonda have no choice but to follow.  As they desperately try to catch up to Val:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Earl looks up ahead.  They're headed right for -- 169   EXT.  THE CLIFFS - DAY                                       169 The massive cliffs.  Earl's eyes bug out.  In seconds they'll be right at the brink with nowhere to run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they skid to a stop at the very brink, Val breaks off the bomb fuse, leaving only one inch of it.  He whirls to check the progress of the advancing creatures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds the bomb out to Rhonda.  She instantly tries to light it.  He grabs her wrist so hard it hurts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The charging creatures are almost underfoot.  Finally Val pulls Rhonda's hand over to light the fuse.  Instantly he hurls the bomb as far as he can, behind the creatures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ground opens under their feet!  Tentacles snake toward Val and Earl.  A horrid mouth clamps onto Rhonda's boot.  She screams as it starts to pull her down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Make noise.  Everybody!  COME ON!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: !  OVER HERE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're not falling for it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll make'em pay attention goddamnit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're...they're trying to make us move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or just knock us over.  Look, use the bomb!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's out last one.  We can't kill them all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Use the fucking bomb!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, we get back on that rock and in three days we're dead anyway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slowly; terrified) I want to live for the three days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: A HUMP STARTS RISING DIRECTLY UNDER HER

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong?  Use the bomb, for Godsake!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No wait!  This way!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gasping) What the hell are you doing?!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: VAL I GOT A GODDAMN PLAN

dialogue.raw_text: This better be one great plan!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get ready!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Light it, man!  LIGHT IT!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not yet, not yet...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Too far!  You threw it behind them!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !!  The bomb explodes!  The creatures shriek in pain, instantly releasing their prey and racing away from the painful shock wave in the only direction they can -- 170   EXT.  CLIFFS - WIDE LOW ANGLE - DAY                          170 Right out through the face of the cliffs !!  The huge, shrieking creatures seem to hang in mid-air for a moment, their grotesque bodies undulating in pain.  And then they fall!  And fall and fall -- a thousand feet!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  BOTTOM OF CLIFFS - DAY                                 171 The creatures land on massive jagged rocks, exploding like immense, horrid watermelons.  Multi-colored gore festoons the whole cliff face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP to see three tiny figures standing at the top of the cliff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  CLIFFS - DAY                                           172 Val peers down at the distant creatures for a long time.  Then he notices Earl and Rhonda are staring at him.  Where the hell did he get an idea like that?  After a moment:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They turn and head back toward the others.  They laugh as they realize how stealthily they are walking.  Val starts taking big, exaggerated stomping steps.  Rhonda and Earl follow suit.  The trio goes off arm in arm, stomping merrily.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it just suddenly hit me, you know?  Stampede?
dialogue.name: dialogue
